definitions.definition: to use your fingers to quickly find something that you cannot see:
examples: He was scrabbling in the sand searching for the ring.

definitions.definition: to try to get something quickly that is not easily available:
examples: The government is scrabbling around for ways to raise revenue without putting up taxes.

definitions.definition: to climb quickly and without care:
examples: Paul scrabbled up the cliff, dislodging several small stones.

definitions.definition: a brand name for a game played on a board covered in squares in which players win points by creating words from letters with different values and connecting these words with ones already on the board
